alert.note: Alert for Caswell; Rockingham; Stokes; Surry; Wilkes; Yadkin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 22 at 8:12PM EST until December 24 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM FRIDAY TO 1 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills are expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. Temperatures will fall quickly leading to a flash freeze of liquid on the ground as well. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northwest North Carolina, and central, south central, southwest and west central Virginia. * WHEN...From 1 PM Friday to 1 PM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory is issued when strong winds will combine with cold temperatures for several hours to create dangerously cold conditions for exposed skin. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Caswell; Rockingham; Stokes; Surry; Wilkes; Yadkin
